subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] from my ohio investigation
author: Vicki Talbott
full_text:
--0-1613304067-1150823972=:23595
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

HI Frank,
  I don't think they do naturally hang around graveyards.  I think they are there when we record or just let them know of our presence.  I know that Braden and friends come to talk just about wherever we are, and that includes the graveyard.  Bayview Cemetery is considered one of the most haunted in Washington state and is just down the road from me and Mary Jo.  Once we went into the mausoleum there, where it was pretty darn scary.  Neither of us got an EVP or an anomalous photo there, despite the strange vibes.  Vicki

Sumption Frank <fsumption@...> wrote:
              Those are interesting for a graveyard. I wouldn�t think the dead would hang around grave yards, that�s why it� not my first choice to record at. Gonna have to re-think some of my pre-conceptions!
  
   Frank
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Jody Cupp
Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2006 10:22 AM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] from my ohio investigation

  
          Here is two more.. LOL.. I need to motivate myself to make the web page. blahh

    

    Any way.  There was this one Grave that we believed was Elizabeths.  We went over there 3 times and could smell lilacs after awhile.  It wasn't immediate, it just slowly came upon us. There was nothing around us to create that odor (not even in the woods), so I'm guessing they were sending it to us. When I say "what are these" I was picking up some of those purple flowers that grow from clover.  They did not produce the scent we were smelling!! It was incredible.  I have experienced this before and to me, it means close to the same thing as roses.  A welcoming, of love and peace.
